question.text: Observe the given diagram of a connective tissue. Identify it. Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the given tissue?

options.text: It is a type of loose areolar tissue.
It is present below the skin as a support framework for epithelium.
Excess of nutrients are converted to fats in this tissue.

solution.text:
Adipose tissue is another type of loose connective tissue located mainly beneath the skin. The cells of this tissue are specialised to store fats. The excess of nutrients which are not used immediately are converted into fats and are stored in this tissue.
Areolar tissue is present beneath the skin. Often it serves as a support framework for epithelium. It contains fibroblasts (cells that produce and secrete fibres), macrophages and mast cells.
